channel.title: Slides on Linux Introduction
channel.description: Recent content in Slides on Linux Introduction

item.title: Slides: Fullscreen
item.description: Package Manager A key aspect of a Linux distribution is the Package Manager. A distribution’s package manager is the preferred tool for managing software on the computer. Package A Package is software and additional metadata. The additional metadata includes: dependencies, version, origin, essential to operating system, conflicts, source, and more. The package contains the executable software and additional data for managing the software. Under the Hood A package is a collection of compressed files that can easily be made into executable files.
